Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange

Umineko Project (UP): A job that you have to do a hundred times and a job that you have to keep repeating until it succeeds with a 1/100 probability.........may look very similar probabilistically, ......but the difference in cruelty between them is great.
Steam (ST): A job you have to do a hundred times...and a job with a 1/100 chance of success that you have to keep doing repeatedly... Probabilistically, they may look very similar, ...but the difference in cruelty between them is great.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A job you have to do a hundred times...and a job that you have to keep repeating until it succeeds with a 1/100 probability......may look very similar probabilistically, ......but the difference in cruelty between them is great.
PC Japanese (JP): 百回を数えたら終わる仕事と、百分の一の確率を得るまで繰り返させられる仕事では、……算数的には同じに見えても、……まったく、その残酷な意味が異なる。
Russian (RU): Работа, которую нужно проделать сто раз, и работа с вероятностью успеха 1/100, которую нужно повторять, пока она не удастся...... могут выглядеть похоже...... но разница в жестокости между ними очень велика.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um trabalho que você precisa fazer cem vezes, e um trabalho que você precisa continuar repetindo, com a chance 1/100 de se obter sucesso.........podem parecer muito similares de um modo de vista de probabilidades, ......mas a diferença na crueldade entre eles é gigante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 重複一百次就結束的工作，和為了碰上那百分之一的可能性而不停重複的工作，……在算術上雖然看起來一樣，……但其殘酷的意義卻完全不同。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 重复一百次就结束的工作，和为了碰上那百分之一的可能性而不停重复的工作，……在算术上虽然看起来一样，……但其残酷的意义却完全不同。

Umineko Project (UP): When you have to do a job a hundred times, you steadily approach the end, get more efficient as you become more used to it, and eventually, you can finish.
Steam (ST): When you have to do a job a hundred times, you steadily approach the end, get more efficient as you become more used to it, and it eventually does end.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When you have to do a job a hundred times, you steadily approach the end, get more efficient as you become more used to it, and it eventually does end.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando você precisa fazer um trabalho cem vezes, conforme o fim vai se aproximando, você se acostuma com ele e se torna mais eficiente e, eventualmente, você o termina.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 重複一百次的工作，踏踏實實地向著終點進發，工作越熟練效率也會越發提高，一定會有結束的時候。

Umineko Project (UP): Zepar and Furfur certainly were demons who possessed a great power.{n}The power of love that they bestowed had created several miracles in the past, miracles so great that they left a mark on human history.
Steam (ST): Zepar and Furfur certainly were demons who possessed a great power. The power of love that they bestowed had created several miracles in the past, miracles so great that they left marks on human history.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Zepar and Furfur certainly were demons who possessed a great power. The power of love that they bestowed had created several miracles in the past...miracles so great that they left a mark on human history.
PC Japanese (JP): ゼパルとフルフルは、確かに強力な力を持つ悪魔だ。彼女らが与える愛の力は、人間の歴史にいくつも残るくらい、数々の奇跡を成し遂げてきた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ゼパルとフルフルは、確かに強力な力を持つ悪魔だ。{n}彼女らが与える愛の力は、人間の歴史にいくつも残るくらい、数々の奇跡を成し遂げてきた。
Russian (RU): Зепар и Фурфур — демоны, обладающие великой силой.{n}Сила любви, которую они даровали, в прошлом творила чудеса — настолько великие, что они оставили след в человеческой истории.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Zepar e Furfur certamente são demônios detentores de um grande poder.{n}O poder do amor que eles concedem já foi capaz de criar diversos milagres no passado; milagres tão grandiosos que deixaram marcas na história da humanidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 賽帕爾和芙爾芙爾，確實是擁有強大力量的惡魔。{n}她們所授予的愛的力量，曾經成就無數奇跡，甚至在人類歷史上也留下了不少印記。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 赛帕尔和芙尔芙尔，确实是拥有强大力量的恶魔。{n}她们所授予的爱的力量，曾经成就无数奇迹，甚至在人类历史上也留下了不少印记。

Umineko Project (UP): However, those miracles were never given easily.
Steam (ST): However, those miracles were never given easily.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, those miracles were never given easily.

Umineko Project (UP): They would give trials, tell riddles, ......and sometimes help the truth be realized, ......so that those who desired power could create that power themselves.
Steam (ST): They would give trials, tell riddles, ...and sometimes help the truth be realized, ...so that those who desired power could create that power themselves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They would give trials, tell riddles, ......and sometimes help the truth be realized......so that those who desired power could create that power themselves.

Russian (RU): Они отводят испытания, говорят загадками...... а иногда и помогают понять правду...... чтобы те, кто желает силы, могли создать эту силу сами.

PC Japanese (JP): その咆哮は、誰の耳にも届かぬ声無きもの。……しかしそれは確かに、大聖堂に響き渡った……。
Russian (RU): Его беззвучный вопль никто не слышал. ......Однако он до сих пор раздавался по всему собору......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu grito sem som não pôde ser ouvido por ninguém. ......Porém, ele ressoou através da catedral......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他無聲的咆哮，沒有任何人聽到。……卻確實在大聖堂內回蕩開來……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他无声的咆哮，没有任何人听到。……却确实在大圣堂内回荡开来……。
